Job Description:
1. To implement and give feedback on corporate product and service features, policies, procedures and guidelines
- Stay updated on the latest modifications and newly created products and services policies, procedures, and guidelines.
- Implement activity plans as communicated by line manager(s) in accordance with Credit Plus department objectives and agreed Memorandum of Understanding with institutional partners. 
- Identify ACs and SMEs financial and training needs and proactively make proposals to fill the gap.
2. To promote Chamroeun’s corporate products and services (financial & educational)
- Identify potential businesses for promotion of Chamroeun’s corporate product and services – Emphasis will be given to Agricultural Cooperatives and high social and and/or environmental value enterprises.
- Work closely with partner organization field representatives (NGOs, local government representatives, Agriculture Cooperatives, Communities, etc.) to encourage potential commercial partners to trust Chamroeun’s products and services.
3. To develop and manage the corporate loan portfolio 
- Accurately collect and analyze corporate partners’ financial statements, cash-flows, business plan, loan purpose and legal documentation, in order to effectively perform the loan appraisal.
- Perform loan utilization checks and monitoring visits after loans are provided; 
4. To develop and provide educational services 
- Develop and manage a range of educational tools and curriculums. Topics include but are not limited to agriculture skill set for small farmers, ACs and SME management; Financial Literacy etc…
- Collect and account for all fees paid by partners for accessing these services.
Company Profile:
1. VISION:
“A leading Cambodian social microfinance institution working to achieve positive and lasting changes in the livelihoods of economically active poor families in a socially responsible manner”

2. MISSION:
“To improve the livelihoods, skills, and self-confidence of poor families in Cambodia by providing responsible microfinance and complementary socio-economic services”

3. CORE VALUES:
■ INTEGRITY: 
Chamroeun provides financial services and socio-economic services to its clients to enhance their well-being. It achieves this ethically and with transparent, fair, and cost effective methods. This manner is also applied to Chamroeun’s other stakeholders.

■ QUALITY OF SERVICES: 
At Chamroeun, we believe that our clients deserve tailored as well as efficient services. We provide these services in a convenient, proactive, and timely manner.

■ TRANSPARENCY: 
At Chamroeun, we provide our clients and other stakeholders with complete and accurate information about the terms and conditions of our products and services. Information is provided in a user-friendly manner to enable them to easily understand those terms and conditions.

■ FAIR PRACTICES: 
At Chamroeun, we ensure that the services we provide to our clients as well as the interactions we have with other stakeholders are not unethical or deceptive. We are committed to building relationships that are based on respect, fair treatments, and courtesy.

■ CONFIDENTIALITY: 
Privacy of our clients and other stakeholders is strictly safeguarded and stored, and such data is only used upon their consents, and they are well informed on specific purposes of data usage.

■ NON-DISCRIMINATION: 
Chamroeun considers its clients and other stakeholders as value assets and take all of efforts to make sure that the institution treats them in appropriate manner.

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

Job Description: PLEASE SEND YOUR CV to recruit.hk@carters.com• Manage garment quality for pre-production, top samples and production through regular factory visits • Proactively follow up cut & sewn & woven children products from market samples till bulk shipment • Closely monitor WIP, shipment booking & closing, and escalate potential delivery issues to Hong Kong cross functional teams• Partner with factories to investigate quality issues, testing failures and assist with recommending a solution to management • Educate vendors on Carter’s quality standards and production issues• Strong collaboration with Hong Kong Sourcing, providing regular and timely updates • Ability to support Technical Design Team through communicating changes in tech packs to vendors• Maintain accurate and timely records in the system, e.g. ensure WIP is completed by vendors
Job Requirement: • University Graduate or High Diploma holder in apparel/Textile• At least 5 years’ work experience in garment field preferably in baby/ children wear• Possess relevant experience in buying / sourcing office and familiar with US/Canada market requirements• Strong experience in woven/knit items and baby/children wear• Well-organized, and good communication skills• Good command of written and spoken English• System savvy and computer knowledge is required – Excel, Power Point and WordInterested parties please send your application and resume in English with Current, Expected Salary & Availability. We offer competitive remuneration package with excellent career prospect to the successful candidate. We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified. Information collected will be used for recruitment purpose only.
Company Profile:
Carter’s is the leading brand of children’s clothing, gifts and accessories in America, selling more than 10 products for every child born in the U.S. Our designs are based on a heritage of quality and innovation that has earned us the trust of generations of families.

We continue this heritage in every little detail to make dressing easier for mom and life more comfortable for babies, and as we move into the future, we are proud to help families like yours with innovative products and new ways to shop for them.

Throughout the years, Carter’s has been known for its thoughtful little details like the Handi-Cuff mitten sleeve that protects babies from self-scratching, and the Jiffon neck design that slips over little ears for easy outfit changes – and although we’ve grown a lot since the early days, we stay true to the philosophy that earned us the trust of generations of families.
Contact Info: Contact Information Rosie Gu  (852) 3896 9368 recruit.hk@carters.com Phnom Penh (852) 3896 9368

Job Description:
- Ensures report verification is done regularly and correctly before performing incoming calculation for both LIC and LIS - - Channel and submitting to finance for payment.

- Good command of English, fluently both written and spoken

Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.
Contact Info: Contact Information PCLA Recruitment HR Manager 087333908 pclarecruitment@prudential.com.kh Phnom Penh Tower, 20F, #445 Monivong Blvd, Boeung Prolit, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 087333908

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information Bunthoeun Keo (Mr.)  088 222 8261 | 016-061 698 602 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 088 222 8261 | 016-061 698 602

job title: Management Trainee (5 Positions) USD250 per month
position: Management Trainee (5 Positions) USD250 per month
Job Description:
The duration of training shall be one (1) year and Trainees shall be rotated to perform different functions such as Human Resources Department, Finance & Accounting, Sales & Marketing, Front Service Operations, Kitchen Operations, and Property Development. Before completion of each attachment, their suitability for absorption shall be decided purely based on their performance during training. During the program, Trainees shall be provided the following training program:
1) Induction on the Company Policies and Practices conducted by the HR Department.
2) On-The-Job Training conducted by the Mentor and/or HOD.
3) Coaching by the Mentor and/or HOD and/or
4) Project Assignment by Mentor and/or HOD.
Job Requirement:
• Fresh graduate students majoring in hospitality and tourism, restaurant operations management, or culinary degree  
• Good study records with GPA of 3.5 or above
• With or without working experience
• Self-motivated, enthusiastic, and ambitious
• Strong interpersonal skills 
• Willing to learn new things and willing to be rotated in different job functions
• Language proficiency in English and Khmer
Company Profile:
Modernity Holding Co., Ltd is an investment and consultant company focusing on various industry projects in Cambodia. We aim to be the platform for investments in SME businesses in Cambodia. Currently, our investment and consultant portfolio heavily focuses on F&B Distribution, Hospitality and Property Development.

Office Working Hour:
Monday to Friday: 8:00 AM to 5:30 PM



If you are dynamic, positive, working hard and smart with an efficiency and effectiveness and seek for a new challenge and growth, we would like to hear from you!

What We Offer:
We provide competitive compensation and benefits, seniority bonus, NSSF,staff birthday, learning opportunities, best career development opportunities, to the successful candidates.

Job Description:
•	To establish first contact with new customers.
•	To detect customer needs and prepare commercial proposals accordingly.
•	To argue/negotiate features and benefits, and overcome objections.
•	To close sales.
•	To follow up projects.
•	To deal with Customer services.
•	To assist the Section Head to manage the stock of products
•	To assist the Section Head to follow up all the POs.
•	To assist the Section Head to follow up all the cash forecasts.
•	To be good understanding of the Section Head job scope and eventually Sales executive have the ability to perform Head Section Manager tasks in case the Head Section Manager is temporarily unavailable.
•	To perform other relevant tasks as required by Section Manager
Job Requirement:
1.	Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering. 
2.	Have experience in marketing.
3.	Good interpersonal skill.
4.	Ability to communicate in English language.
5.	Have experience in filing system.
6.	Able to work with the team.
7.	Able to work under pressure

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information Comin Asia  095 777 480/095 666901/0963228856 ck.hr@comin.com.kh #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 095 777 480/095 666901/0963228856

Job Description:
• To realize site inspection and project specifications & drawings analysis.
• To issue with the design team preliminary design (in case that the design is not available in tender documents) & equipment selection.
• To issue the design team the bill of quantities, labor, material and equipment etc.
• To provide technical support to the sales team in the negotiation of the contract.
• To liaise with the design office the detail design including single line diagram, load calculation, distribution and panel boards schematic diagrams, size cable and wiring layout, final selection if equipment.
• To prepare construction document to be forwarded to the site including bill of quantity of equipment, construction drawings and technical specifications.
• To perform other relevant tasks as required by Design Manager.
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor Degree in Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing Engineering or related field. 
Engineering or related field.
• Have some knowledge of Air Distribution system, Hydraulic network, ACMV Equipment selection on chilled water system and direct expansion systems, Smoke exhaust system, water filtration system, hot water production, Electrical Engineering (Medium & Low Voltage Distribution, Telephone & Data systems, Fire Detection systems, CCTV systems, Public Address systems & MATV systems) Plumbing (Fire Protection System, Hot and Cold Water System, Sanitary and Sewer System, Storm Drain System).
• Ability to communicate effectively in English both verbally and in writing.
• Computer literacy and especially MS Offices, MS Project, AutoCAD, Projects 2000.
• Project Management knowledge.
• Negotiation skill.
• Good interpersonal skill.

+Benefit: 
-	Seniority   pay
-	13 salary
-	Annual Party
-	Annual Trip
-	Sick Leave 
-	Special Leave
-	Maternity Leave
-	OT
-	Annual Leave 18 day/years
-	Insurance (Philip insurance/ NSSF)
-	Incentive
-	KPI Performance 
-	Opportunity to Train at Over Sea. 
-	Training Course (Soft Skill and Hard Skill)
-	 Training Course (Computer Skill, English Program)

Job Description:
• Functional Responsibilities 
 Inventory Costing, including Raw Materials, Semi-Finished Goods and Finished
 Ensure monthly cost of goods sold by store accurate 
 Sales Pricing / Invoicing of Inventory to related parties
 Daily check and monitor local stock. Report discrepancy to Head of Brands and Head of Finance for further variance action.
 Weekly spot check stock movement at all stores and central kitchen. Report discrepancy and coach store manager to do the stock count. 
 Coordinate in bi-year stock physical count, input and reconcile. 
 Coordinate to get month-end stock balance from all outlets by 1st of the month. Verify and input into system for month-end cost calculation. 
 Work on landed cost to ensure costing is input accurately and timely manner.
 Obtain all new recipe from all brands before product/program launched to ensure accurate cost of BOM. 
 Regularly follow up with all brands to obtain any revised menu recipe before product launched. 
 Send accurate monthly average consumption by brand to procurement for correct stock order. 
 Coordinate and verify on the new code with supply chain. Ensure information of each items are complete. 
 Report to Brand Managers/GM on cost of Expiring Inventory 
 Report to CF0/GM the inventory reconciles sub ledger with G/L 
 Other tasks assigned by Report and Planning Manager
Job Requirement:
 Minimum 3 year experiences in Accounting or Cost Accounting. 
 Advance knowledge of Microsoft office, MS Excel and reporting tools 
 Good communication 
 Experience in the Food/ FMCG business is an advantage. 
 Knowledge of integrated ERP Systems. 
 Good command in both spoken and written English 
 Strong commitment 
 Pro-active, initiative, responsible and a team player activity to prioritize works to reach deadline

-	Benefit: 
-	Seniority   pay
-	13 salary
-	Annual Party
-	Annual Trip
-	Sick Leave 
-	Special Leave
-	Maternity Leave
-	OT
-	Annual Leave 18 day/years
-	Insurance (Philip insurance/ NSSF)
-	Incentive
-	KPI Performance 
-	Opportunity to Train at Over Sea. 
-	Training Course (Soft Skill and Hard Skill)
-	 Training Course (Computer Skill, English Program)

Job Description:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
- Manage and support to subordinates  	     				                                - Present and sell company products to customers
- Execute sale activities and follow-up with customers
- Commit to achieve the sales target assigned
- Contact and visit current, new and perspective customers
- Maintain and develop relationships with customers
- Other tasks assigned by Business Manager
Job Requirement:
REQUIREMENT
- Bachelor degree in Sales & Marketing, Business Administration or related fields
- Min.4 years of experience (and 2 years as supervisory levels)
- Computer literacy (Ms. Office: word, Excel, internet and Email)
- Willing to learn new things and can work under pressure
- Honest, punctual, responsible, commitment and teamwork
BENEFITS
1. Competitive benefit packages
2. Annual salary increment
3. Provide training, opportunity for growth, and job promotions
4. Other benefits based on internal policies
HOW TO APPLY
Interested candidates please send CVs email: hr.sbcgroup@gmail.com or contact 086 936 836. Please do not attach certificates and supporting documents. Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for interviews.
Address: Building #321, Mao Tse Toung Blvd, Sangkat Phsar Depo I, Khan Toul Kork, Phnom Penh

Contact Info: Contact Information Franklin NS  086 936 836 hr.sbcgroup@gmail.com Building #321, Mao Tse Toung Blvd, Sangkat Phsar Depo I, Khan Toul Kork, Phnom Penh 086 936 836

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information Comin Asia  095 777 480/095 666901/0963228856 ck.hr@comin.com.kh #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 095 777 480/095 666901/0963228856

Job Description:
• To realize site inspection and project specifications & drawings analysis.
• To issue with the design team preliminary design (in case that the design is not available in tender documents) & equipment selection.
• To issue the design team the bill of quantities, labor, material and equipment etc.
• To provide technical support to the sales team in the negotiation of the contract.
• To liaise with the design office the detail design including single line diagram, load calculation, distribution and panel boards schematic diagrams, size cable and wiring layout, final selection if equipment.
• To prepare construction document to be forwarded to the site including bill of quantity of equipment, construction drawings and technical specifications.
• To perform other relevant tasks as required by Design Manager.
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor Degree in Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing Engineering or related field. 
Engineering or related field.
• Have some knowledge of Air Distribution system, Hydraulic network, ACMV Equipment selection on chilled water system and direct expansion systems, Smoke exhaust system, water filtration system, hot water production, Electrical Engineering (Medium & Low Voltage Distribution, Telephone & Data systems, Fire Detection systems, CCTV systems, Public Address systems & MATV systems) Plumbing (Fire Protection System, Hot and Cold Water System, Sanitary and Sewer System, Storm Drain System).
• Ability to communicate effectively in English both verbally and in writing.
• Computer literacy and especially MS Offices, MS Project, AutoCAD, Projects 2000.
• Project Management knowledge.
• Negotiation skill.
• Good interpersonal skill.

Job Description:
• Functional Responsibilities 
 Inventory Costing, including Raw Materials, Semi-Finished Goods and Finished
 Ensure monthly cost of goods sold by store accurate 
 Sales Pricing / Invoicing of Inventory to related parties
 Daily check and monitor local stock. Report discrepancy to Head of Brands and Head of Finance for further variance action.
 Weekly spot check stock movement at all stores and central kitchen. Report discrepancy and coach store manager to do the stock count. 
 Coordinate in bi-year stock physical count, input and reconcile. 
 Coordinate to get month-end stock balance from all outlets by 1st of the month. Verify and input into system for month-end cost calculation. 
 Work on landed cost to ensure costing is input accurately and timely manner.
 Obtain all new recipe from all brands before product/program launched to ensure accurate cost of BOM. 
 Regularly follow up with all brands to obtain any revised menu recipe before product launched. 
 Send accurate monthly average consumption by brand to procurement for correct stock order. 
 Coordinate and verify on the new code with supply chain. Ensure information of each items are complete. 
 Report to Brand Managers/GM on cost of Expiring Inventory 
 Report to CF0/GM the inventory reconciles sub ledger with G/L 
 Other tasks assigned by Report and Planning Manager
Job Requirement:
 Minimum 3 year experiences in Accounting or Cost Accounting. 
 Advance knowledge of Microsoft office, MS Excel and reporting tools 
 Good communication 
 Experience in the Food/ FMCG business is an advantage. 
 Knowledge of integrated ERP Systems. 
 Good command in both spoken and written English 
 Strong commitment 
 Pro-active, initiative, responsible and a team player activity to prioritize works to reach deadline

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information Comin Asia  095 777 480/095 666901/0963228856 ck.hr@comin.com.kh #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 095 777 480/095 666901/0963228856

Job Description:
- To follow-up the maintenance progress of Lift Section.
- To manage electrical workshop and the property in this workshop.
- To check the daily reports and maintenance reports of his staffs.

- To monitor the profit margin.

- To ensure that his staffs and subcontractors follow the company rules and regulations during their work.

- To conduct site inspection and make the report of site inspection.
- To do monthly and yearly appraisal of his staffs ‘performance.
- To perform other relevant tasks as required by Section Manager
Job Requirement:

- Some excellent technical experience with lift and lift products.
- Management skills.
- Good interpersonal skills and negotiation skills.
- Team spirit and high responsibility.
- Computer literacy.
- Fluency in English and Khmer language

Job Description:
• To realize site inspection and project specifications & drawings analysis.
• To issue with the design team preliminary design (in case that the design is not available in tender documents) & equipment selection.
• To issue the design team the bill of quantities, labor, material and equipment etc.
• To provide technical support to the sales team in the negotiation of the contract.
• To liaise with the design office the detail design including single line diagram, load calculation, distribution and panel boards schematic diagrams, size cable and wiring layout, final selection if equipment.
• To prepare construction document to be forwarded to the site including bill of quantity of equipment, construction drawings and technical specifications.
• To perform other relevant tasks as required by Design Manager.
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor Degree in Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing Engineering or related field. 
Engineering or related field.
• Have some knowledge of Air Distribution system, Hydraulic network, ACMV Equipment selection on chilled water system and direct expansion systems, Smoke exhaust system, water filtration system, hot water production, Electrical Engineering (Medium & Low Voltage Distribution, Telephone & Data systems, Fire Detection systems, CCTV systems, Public Address systems & MATV systems) Plumbing (Fire Protection System, Hot and Cold Water System, Sanitary and Sewer System, Storm Drain System).
• Ability to communicate effectively in English both verbally and in writing.
• Computer literacy and especially MS Offices, MS Project, AutoCAD, Projects 2000.
• Project Management knowledge.
• Negotiation skill.
• Good interpersonal skill.

Job Description:
•	To identify potential customers in all the provinces and throughout 3 key sectors: hospitality, corporate and residential/real estate. Emphasis should be placed on Phnom Penh, Siem Reap, Battambang and Sihanoukville.
•	To detect customers’ needs and prepare commercial proposals accordingly.
•	To argue/negotiate product’s specifications, usage and benefits, and overcome objections.
•	To be responsible for developing sales of Onity products, follow up ongoing projects and ensure after-sales customer services with the technical assistance of our Service Division.
•	To assist the Section Manager to manage the stock of products & spare parts.
•	To assist the Section Manager to follow up on the POs and cash flow forecasts.
•	To set up annual business plans to increase the volume of sales and develop support documents and marketing tools (in both English and Khmer languages) to promote Onity products.
•	To take in charge the delivery of products and spare parts.
•	To train end-users to properly use the products.
•	To perform other relevant tasks as required by Section Manager.
Job Requirement:
1.	Bachelor Degree in Business Administration, Sales & Marketing field.
2.	Have at least one-year experience in sales/marketing.
3.	Have good interpersonal skills.
4.	Have good English in both “writing and speaking”.
5.	Have good presentation skills. 
6.	Be reliable, responsible, and dependable in fulfilling obligations and team work.
7.	Be pleasant and display a good-natured, honest and ethical attitude.
8.	Be able to work under pressure.

Job Description:
- Report to the Ford General Manager
- Work with Sales team
- Work with Marketing team
- Work with Aftersales team
- Work with Trade-In Operation team
- Work with the RMA Group
- Finance, HR and other supporting departments at head 
- Suppliers (Ford Motor Company and Others)
- Customers
- Authorities 
- Work with CEO and General Manager to develop annual sales & production planning (S&OP) and a rolling forecast 
- Manage vehicles ordering following FORD ordering pattern
- Work with sales team and modification team in Headquarter to customize the vehicle following the specific need of the customer
- Be a contact window Ford Motor Company on the vehicle production arrangement and pricing
- Closely monitor inventory Vs sales performance and alert General Manager if any negative sign
- Control production orders Vs outstanding sales contracts and take immediate action on shortage or surplus 
- Put in place the system to monitor sales performance (daily contract, daily delivery)
- Daily manage new vehicles sales contracts signed during absence of Sales Manager
- Provide daily support to sales team in solving any issue (production disruption, wrong product, late PDI…)
- Work with Logistics and Finance department to ensure smooth supply of vehicles
- Master vehicle cost breakdown structure 
- Work with General Manager to set up a price list to ensure a good profit margin and stay competitive in the market
- Assist General Manager in setting up product strategy
- Work with General Managers, Sales Manager, Marketing Manager and Aftersales Manager to set strategic direction for Ford division
- Work with General Manager to prepare and update Balanced Scorecard for Ford division in line with the company objectives 
- Work with Marketing Intelligent to stay up-to-date the automotive market share and market information
- Work with logistics and government authorities if any new regulation imposed on the automotive industry
- Work with legal department on obtaining exclusive rights from the Ministry of Commerce
- Collect and analyze all data/information and prepare the meeting presentation for General Manager
- Assist General Manager in setting up the meeting schedule and updating the progress
- Examine regular check with Finance and Insurance department to ensure all company assets are properly insured
- Provide guidance, coach and support to administrative department
- Any other duties as and when required by General Manager.
- Delivered monthly financial analysis and insights to make better business decisions by highlighting variances to Budget or Target and Trends from P&L
- Control monthly sales profitability and take corrective action if any
- Examine expense analysis (Actual Vs Budget) in taking into account the growth of sales Vs budget and take corrective action on any abnormal expense
- Work with Finance to ensure expenses are booked at the right accounts
- Maintain an effective control of expenses in line with agreed objectives 
- Monitor inventory level and alert General Manager to take immediate action on Aged Inventory
- Examine weekly Account Receivable (AR) analysis to ensure that all outstanding receivable have been collected within approved credit term and reinforce credit policy
- Mange company assets (demo vehicles and others) 
- Manage and develop staff
- Assist General Manager in setting up clear organizational chart for Ford division and putting people at the right place
- Lead morning meeting for both Sales & Aftersales staff
- Organize monthly division meeting & quarterly gathering to which all staff are required to join and raise up their concerns to General Manager
- Be a Go-To person whom any staff feel comfortable to raise any issues
- Work with HR to establish and maintain a training needs analysis (T.N.A.) 
- Reinforce the implementation of company’s rule and regulation
Job Requirement:
• Management, Business Administration, Finance and Accounting, IR and Related skills

• At least 5 years prior experience working as administration and assistant to GM/Director/CEO 
• Demonstrable track record of developing and training staff.
• Skillful and sensitive communication skills – for dealing with VIP customers and managing a team across cultures. Self-aware, patient and calm approach
• Experience of organizing clerical work, administration, control systems and financial resources of a trading operation.
• Relevant and up-to-date knowledge of vehicle design and manufacture, consumer and vehicle legislation, industry and trade practices.
• High standards of numeracy and literacy and strong communication skills.
• Technical knowledge and experience of the retail motor industry at a senior level.
• A strong command of English (Writing, Reading and Speaking)
Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  017888390 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 017888390

Job Description:
• People management: responsible for the organization and performance of a growing team of after sales service personnel – including both in field & workshop activities. 
• Implementing and maintaining activity and other company management systems as required assisting in the overall management of this support division. 
• Identifying appropriate training and staffing requirements to meet both existing and future needs. 
• Actively striving for best practices in customer satisfaction and support with regular updates to management on appropriate recommendations
• Preparation of operational and capital budgets as required and actively striving to meet targets.
• Ensuring customer service performance by service personal is professional and appropriate to support business growth, brand differentiation, sales margin and customer loyalty.
• Optimizing spare parts stock levels, costs and availability for customers buy regularly reviewing on items of concern. 
• Efficient management and scheduling of resources for the maintenance, service and other operations as required by GM. 
• Identification of materials, parts and equipment for purchase to achieve value for money.
• Interact at a management level with all departments to ensure seem-less flow for work performance and information is maintained at all times. 
• Developing and implementing the necessary infrastructure and processes to support future growth. This includes systems, procedures, customer service, training, management information and performance controls. 
• Develop manage and deliver efficiency KPI’s for the After Sales Service Department in conjunction with the General Manager.
• Actively solicit additional business for the After Sales department.
• Report monthly on overall  P & L of After Sales business
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor degree of Mechanic, Automotive, and Electrical or  related fields 
• Highest level of business ethics  
• Excellent  English (written and spoken)
• Fully conversant with Microsoft suite of products and fully computer literate.
. Be familiar with leadership and people management. 
. Male is preferable.

Job Description: Developing system architecture solutions mapping the business requirements to systems/technical requirements, analyzing the impact and enterprise specifics on the overall business goals and outcomes to ensure they are in line with the enterprise architectural plan.- Strategizing, planning and implementing new IT / billing Platform/ software requirement as per Business Plan.- Review, interpret and respond to detailed business requirements specifications to ensure alignment between customer expectations and current or future ICT capability- Provide input to the strategic direction of technology investments to assist in the development of the enterprise architecture and maximise the return on technology investment- Assist IT Solution Delivery to support Marketing departments for the design, development and delivery of consumer facing products and services to ensure the right balance is kept between the capabilities of the system and meeting the business requirements.- Within the agreed enterprise architecture, define and design technology solutions to assist the business in meeting their business objectives by coordinating with vendors and platform owner to produce requirements and design documents ensuring they represent the business needs.- Develop, test, and implement technology solutions and report on delivery commitments to ensure solutions are implemented as expected and to agreed time frames- Work closely with vendor and platform owner to ensure the solution delivered as per design, expected quality, and timeline. Conducting sanity check on the environment before passing to Release management and Quality Assurance.- Maintain documentation regarding system architecture configuration, application workflow, and business rules- Development, plan, and update of IT / network/system software architecture document in order follow technology trend.
Job Requirement: - University degree or a relevant undergraduate / professional qualification in Information Technology, Telecommunication Technology or Software engineering/Computer Science- At least 5 years experience. Experience of successfully delivering challenging information technology projects, meeting range key targets, and making signification improvements.- Minimum of 3 year working experiences in similar role in major complex organizations.- Include experience of communication and working collaboratively with diverse range of stakeholders at all levels including senior management and key professional staff, both internal and external to the organization, in order to achieve successful outcomes.- Strong analytical skill & negotiation quality, high level of interpersonal relationship, and teamwork.- Fluent in English writing and communication

Job Description:
• Functional Responsibilities 
 Inventory Costing, including Raw Materials, Semi-Finished Goods and Finished
 Ensure monthly cost of goods sold by store accurate 
 Sales Pricing / Invoicing of Inventory to related parties
 Daily check and monitor local stock. Report discrepancy to Head of Brands and Head of Finance for further variance action.
 Weekly spot check stock movement at all stores and central kitchen. Report discrepancy and coach store manager to do the stock count. 
 Coordinate in bi-year stock physical count, input and reconcile. 
 Coordinate to get month-end stock balance from all outlets by 1st of the month. Verify and input into system for month-end cost calculation. 
 Work on landed cost to ensure costing is input accurately and timely manner.
 Obtain all new recipe from all brands before product/program launched to ensure accurate cost of BOM. 
 Regularly follow up with all brands to obtain any revised menu recipe before product launched. 
 Send accurate monthly average consumption by brand to procurement for correct stock order. 
 Coordinate and verify on the new code with supply chain. Ensure information of each items are complete. 
 Report to Brand Managers/GM on cost of Expiring Inventory 
 Report to CF0/GM the inventory reconciles sub ledger with G/L 
 Other tasks assigned by Report and Planning Manager
Job Requirement:
 Minimum 3 year experiences in Accounting or Cost Accounting. 
 Advance knowledge of Microsoft office, MS Excel and reporting tools 
 Good communication 
 Experience in the Food/ FMCG business is an advantage. 
 Knowledge of integrated ERP Systems. 
 Good command in both spoken and written English 
 Strong commitment 
 Pro-active, initiative, responsible and a team player activity to prioritize works to reach deadline

Job Description:
• Develop sales plan and sales strategy for the market that ensures attainment of company sales goals and profitability.
• Builds a winning team by recruiting, hiring, training, coaching, evaluating, motivating, and rewarding Parts Department employees.
• Maintain up-to-date knowledge of target customer sectors and key prospects/clients.
• Act as the 'subject matter expert' for the team and colleagues in other departments regarding key markets and customers, developing their knowledge and experience.
• Establishes a process to ensure accuracy between inventory actual and system
• Utilizes new systems or processes implemented by Ford or RMA Group
• Responsible for optimizing of Ford parts, by providing outstanding sales leadership.
• Being a key client interface with all existing customers and potential clients.
• A key focus will be sales growth, ensuring that strong sales processes are in place. Key focus on workshop sales and wholesale channel.
• Working with after-sales manager in advising and taking the lead in suggesting and executing innovative marketing and sales ideas.
• Be a crucial part of a motivated management team, you will be expected to analyze and compile sales competitor market information.
• Manages the day to day operations of the Parts Department to ensure the achievements of key targets.
• Maintains an efficient parts service to all customers.
• Ensure systems are used and kept up-to-date to monitor and record relevant data.
• Maintain stock levels, purchasing within agreed budgets. Forecast future inventory storage aligned with sales growth.
• Monitor stock overheads and stock values, reporting any which exceed the budget to After-sales Manager.
• Review current procedures and identify opportunities for improvement.
• Ensures the Parts Team follow procedures and record all transactions, liaising with other departments as required.
• Working closely with all clients (internal or external) to ensure all orders are managed efficiently and agreed deadlines are achieved.
• Ensure tight control of aged stock to minimize obsolescence.
• Strong warehouse controls, i.e., super session, FIFO, etc,

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Job Description:
The Architect is in charge of overseeing timely and profitable completion of a project, consult with clients, and draw design. This will need to develop project cost estimates, review construction bids
and contracts, coordinate implementation of capital improvement projects, administer agreements
with consultant architects and engineers, and perform related work as required.

• Work independently or with consultant architects/engineers, design and prepare plans and
specifications, develop cost estimates, and coordinates implementation of capital improvement
projects, oversee the work and administers consultant construction.
• Develop construction bid proposals, review bid specifications, recommend contract approval and
administer contracts with consultant architects and engineers.
• Participate in final inspection of improvement projects and makes recommendation regarding
acceptance of construction work.
• May review building plans and site design for aesthetics, environmental acceptability, compliance
with codes and standards and accessibility requirements.
• Prepare reports and correspondence.
• Design projects and/or review architectural or engineering plans, specifications and contract
documents to ensure compliance with government codes, laws and regulations.
• Advise Subcontractors on the interpretation of plans, recommend changes when necessary.
• Prepare and/or review preliminary designs, working drawings, specifications and cost estimates
related to the project.
• Provide technical expertise in development or review of policies and procedures in relation to
architectural structures and systems and construction/safety codes.
• Provide advice and develop design documents to initiate and modify architectural, interior design
and space planning solutions.
• Perform design drafting including preliminary drawings, working drawings and full detail drawings
for architectural, structural and mechanical works associated with building construction or
improvement projects.
• Review Subcontractor's shop drawings to ensure compliance with specifications and contract
agreements by checking them for technical accuracy according to accepted guidelines.
• Work with customers and Clients to gather facts, defines design and space planning problems,
conceptualize possible solutions and secure approvals of proposals.
• Collaborate and energize the design team to develop solutions to design problems.
• Originate and develop creative design concepts and design documents in all phases.
• Use computer programs such as AutoCAD Architecture, 3D Studio MAX, Sketch up Pro., V-Ray
Plug-in, Adobe Creative Suites at Very good level or higher.
Job Requirement: • Bachelors or Master's Degree in Architecture.• Proven track record with 5 year experience.• Good analytical and problem-solving skills.• Be confident, assertive and independent.• Possesses intermediate knowledge of applicable codes, and implications on design.• Demonstrated success in taking projects through design review process.• Ability to discuss and debate philosophical design issues and solve complex project issues.• Demonstrated ability to lead the client, project stakeholders and project team in an integrateddesign process.• Advanced design, visual and graphic presentation skills required .• Knowledge of Building Information Modeling (BIM} and Project Delivery methods, preferable.• Proficiency with physical models.• Ability to work in team environment and supervise others.• Ability to communicate both verbally and in writing in English.• Ability to plan and manage design team efforts to effectively meet deadlines.• Good interpersonal skill in English and attention to detail.• Empathy CMEDCC Management philosophy.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.

Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.

Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.

job title: Director of Finance and Business Improvement (FBI)
position: Director of Finance and Business Improvement (FBI)
Job Description:
** Position Summary:
- Director of FBI works closely with President and Department Heads to oversee the Financial and Business Functions of the University 
- Director of FBI supervises Finance, Accounting, Tax and Procurement functions of the university 

The overall job description below outlines the main areas of responsibilities of the Employee:
- Responsible for overall supervision of Finance Department to efficiently perform the financial management functions to achieve UP’s goals and in compliance within technical standards and tax provisions, including proper recording of line items in the income statement, accounts receivable in the balance sheet and proper cash reconciliation 
- Responsible for planning, organising, controlling and monitoring financial resources in order to achieve the University’s objectives 
- Responsible for monitoring budget vs. actual expenses 
- Undertake Internal Monthly Financial Performance reports with Heads of Dept 
- Undertake Quarterly reforecasts of Financial Performance under Direction of President 
- Prepare yearly budget under Direction of President 
- Make recommendations to the management to ensure the overall financial management of UP is sound and in line with the President vision 
- Review and approve payments 
- Review and approve monthly payroll 
-Manage the cash flow forecast 
•	Handle Annual Tax Returns 
•	Perform analysis of financial and management reports and submit report to management with recommendations on variance, possible savings and to enable monthly decision making 
•	Coordinate with departments to develop management account basis for reasonable allocation of revenues and expenses into its relevant cost centers/departments 
•	Maintain a documented system of accounting policies and procedures 
•	Monitor movement over fixed assets and ensure proper procurement process for such 
•	Prepare, monitor and analyze the UP’s procedures and internal control systems 
•	Manage relationships with external parties such as external auditors, bank relationship managers, and tax auditors 
•	Report to the President and Group about UP monthly and yearly financial performance 
•	Lead Performance Improvement activities
Job Requirement:
1.	Education:
•	Master Degree in Accounting and Finance or other equivalent 

2.	Experience:
•	At least 10 years’ experience in Finance & Accounting supervision 
•	Knowledge in Computer Word and Advanced Excel 
•	Knowledge/experience of Sage ERP would be an asset 

3.	Skills/Competencies:
•	Fluent in written and spoken English 
•	Proficiency in Khmer preferred 
•	Accurate documentation and reporting skills 
•	Ability to work independently while also functioning as a member of a team 

4.	Personal Quality
•	Solutions oriented 
•	Demonstrated ability to lead and direct

job title: Director of Quality, Learning and Teaching, and Students (QLTS)
position: Director of Quality, Learning and Teaching, and Students (QLTS)
Job Description:
The Director of QLTS is a senior member of Leadership Team, responsible for 4 departments:
1.	Learning and Teaching
2.	Learning Centre (Library)
3.	Student Services
4.	Engagement and Partnerships

1.	Duties and Responsibilities – QLTS (General)
•	Lead, develop and engage a high performing professional team to be positive contributors to continuous development and improvement across the services for the benefit of staff and students.
•	Provide strategic leadership, including development and regular review of the QLTS strategic plan, ensuring that implementation is consistent with overall faculty and UP strategy
•	Direct, support, guidance, monitoring, inspection, evaluation and reporting of the policies and processes for the assurance and auditing of quality and standards at the University as identified by the ACC and Cambodian Curriculum Framework

2.	Duties and Responsibilities – Learning and Teaching

•	Lead the development, assessment and improvement of Learning and Teaching team to meet and support UP’s mission and strategic plan
•	Continue the development of a community of practice in pedagogies that are relevant to UP, contemporary and focused on enhancing student experience for flexible, digital and blended learning contexts.
•	Advise relevant groups on trends and developments in pedagogy, learning and assessment design practices, and policy
•	Lead and develop training programs for staff to improve their own pedagogical approaches to maximize academic quality and student outcomes
•	Provide independent advice to the President and Faculties regarding Academic Quality, compliance and benchmarking to international best practice
•	Work with Faculties to review courses, and develop gap analyses assessments against international best practice and advise/work with Faculties to achieve best practices.
•	Support and improve the teaching objectives of the Faculties by delivering guidance and mentoring (group and individual) on contemporary Learning and Teaching approaches particularly online, blended and flipped learning.
•	Contribute to the development of new teaching approaches, course proposals and to the design of curricula which are academically excellent, coherent and intellectually challenging
•	Ensure that course design and delivery comply with the quality standards and regulations of the University
•	Provide training and support to staff on modern Learning and Teaching approaches and enable Learning and Teaching Champions.
•	Investigate and develop innovative teaching, learning and assessment methods and techniques in the sector, and pedagogic research generally, bringing new insights to UP or department
•	Perform other duties and assume additional responsibilities as assigned by the President


3.	Duties and Responsibilities – Student Services

•	Lead the development, assessment and improvement of Learning and Teaching team to meet and support UP’s mission and strategic plan
•	Lead the development, assessment and improvement of student services and experience to meet and support UP’s mission and strategic plan
•	Manage all administrative tasks relating to the department and manage staff in the Department
•	Develop relationships with students and student leaders, and communicate with students effectively and regularly
•	Understand the needs of academic faculties and departments and work with them to develop relationships that support their departments and their students.
•	Oversee selection of students for scholarships and opportunities to work/study abroad
•	Work with the marketing department to promote student clubs, community activities and programs
•	Design, coordinate and implement programs and services for students in response to their needs (Including career development skills and leadership workshops, career advisory sessions to outreaches and community programs)
•	Research opportunities and processes to develop online engagement and support for students

4.	Duties and Responsibilities – Learning Centre

•	Lead the strategic and operational improvement of Learning Centre team to provide to support contemporary learning, teaching and research
•	Develop an innovative strategy that transforms Learning Centre services, particularly in relation to digital and blended learning provision.
•	Provide training on teaching methods and tools including online, flipped learning for staff and students
•	Develop and oversee Digital Learning facilitators in provision of quality training and support for staff and students
•	Oversee the operation of the library to ensure that the library management and library system run smoothly
•	Foster an attractive library environment that allows students to access relevant learning and research materials with ease

5.	Duties and responsibilities - Engagement and Partnerships 

•	Lead the development, assessment and improvement of Engagement and Partnerships to meet and support UP’s mission and strategic plan
•	Develop and manage relationships with University alumni to build mutually-productive partnerships locally, nationally, and internationally.
•	Manage and improve relationships with current partners and identify and develop new partnerships with educational institutions, NGOs, health care service providers, companies and relevant industry players in health care and technology to facilitate student exchanges, internships, volunteer opportunities and personal development opportunities.
Job Requirement:
1. Experience:
•	At least 3 years as a senior Academic and/or leader of Learning, Teaching, and Student Support Teams
•	Proven experience of working within a regulatory framework;
•	An experienced administrator with Knowledge and understanding of quality assurance in a University context;

2. Education:
•	Bachelors (Masters preferred) degree in Learning and Teaching discipline

3. Skills/Competencies:
•	Demonstrated expertise in contemporary pedagogical thinking, flexible learning approaches and innovative digital technologies to shape new learning experiences.
•	Demonstrated ability to draw upon new and emerging technologies and practice for the effective application of innovative use of tools and learning and assessment pedagogies
•	Demonstrated knowledge and application of student services functions
•	Demonstrated knowledge of principles and processes for delivering student services.
•	Excellent communication skills and ability to work as a team
•	Excellent oral and written command of English
•	Excellent oral and written command of Khmer would be highly regarded
•	Knowledge of higher education and ability to use a range of delivery techniques to enthuse and engage students
•	Experience of knowledge exchange related activities is desirable
•	Experience of curriculum development

The University welcomes Cambodian and international candidates

Job Description:
*** Position Summary:

- Provide high-quality, evidence-based, student-centered, theoretical and practical education in accordance with MOH & MoEYS Pharmacy curriculum requirements to ensure that UP pharmacy graduates as competent, qualified and professional pharmacist
- Develop standard course outlines, assessment course books and reference books of teaching courses in pharmacognosy, plant biology, botany, and Cryptogamy and Toxic Plants according to guidelines or policies of MoH and MoEYS
- Ensure a standard and effective evaluation of lecturers’ teaching performance in pharmacognosy, plant biology, botany, and Cryptogamy and Toxic Plants
- Conduct Research to publish in local and international journals

** Duties and Responsibilities:

The overall job description below outlines the main areas of responsibilities of the Employee:
- Teach or assist in teaching subjects in the field of pharmacognosy, plant biology, botany, and Cryptogamy and Toxic Plants based on standard course outlines, ensuring they are evidence based, continually updated and linked in with other relevant courses and will develop higher levels of students’ learning
- Develop standard course outlines, course books and reference books of pharmacognosy, plant biology, botany, and Cryptogamy and Toxic Plants according to guidelines or policies of MoH, MoEYS as well as UP
- Develop a standard evaluation form of pharmacy lecturers’ teaching performance. Identify and evaluate teaching performance based on evaluation result and recommend effective strategy or tactic to ensure high teaching quality in Faculty of Pharmacy
- Develop research activities (protocols, research center, personnel, equipment etc) by cooperating with internal and external partners
- Conduct and advice students to conduct research to publish in local and international journals
- Assist in recommending wide range of learning and teaching resources (Theory and Practice) to students and lecturers
- Assist in developing a new pharmacy curriculum which responses to pharmacist core competency inside Cambodia and outside context
- Assist in participation of making pharmacy related policy, guideline, regulations, rule etc in the faculty of pharmacy 
- Work closely with pharmacy team in order to strengthen the knowledge, skills and attitudes of students and lecturers
- Perform other duties as assigned by Head of Department/Dean
Job Requirement:
1.	Experience
•	3 years teaching experience in Plant Biology/Pharmacognosy
2.	Education
•	Master’s Degree/Doctor’s Degree in Pharmacognosy/Plant biology or equivalent
•	Strong English proficiency: Reading, Speaking, Writing and Listening
3.	Skills/Competencies:
•	Strong computer skills: Microsoft word, Excel.
4.	Personal Quality 
•	Strong communication skills
•	Strong Leadership and coordinating skills
•	Good attitude and behavior
•	Ability to work under pressure
Company Profile: The University of Puthisastra (UP) is a private university in Phnom Penh that focuses on health sciences and technology.  UP is committed to developing higher education in Cambodia and enabling its students to become future leaders of Cambodia in health care and technology.

Job Description:
Responsibilities 
• Planning concepts by studying relevant information and materials. 
• Illustrating concepts by designing examples of art arrangement, size, type size and style. 
• Preparing finished art by operating necessary equipment and software. 
• Coordinating with web designer, marketing team, and colleagues as necessary. 
• Contributing to team efforts by accomplishing tasks as needed. 
• Communicating with clients about layout and design. 
• Creating a wide range of graphics and layouts for product illustrations, company branding. 
• Reviewing final layouts and suggesting improvements when necessary.
Job Requirement:
Requirements
• Proficient in graphic design, typography and concept development.
• Able to research and communicate/interpret conceptual ideas quickly.
• Must be extremely detail oriented and organized.
• Excellent working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite: Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign.
• Standard video editing skills (Premiere Pro, After Effects) is a plus.
• Highly motivated with ability to work in a deadline-driven environment.
• Good organization and time management skills.
• Basic English (speaking/reading) is required. Good command of English.
Key Competencies
• Team work
• Confidentiality
• Creativity
• Responsible and commit to time line
Other Details
• Start Date: ASAP
• Location: Phnom Penh
• Working Hour: 8hours/day (Mon-Fri)
• Contact: Ms. Sun Sreylin, 
email: SUN.Sreylin@hellokrupet.com
Company Profile:
Who We Are
Hello Health is a leading health tech company in Asia. Our goal is to lead Asia in the creation of healthcare knowledge, making world class, trustworthy health information accessible and useful; empowering our audience to live happier and healthier lives. Founded in July 2015 we have successfully launched in 9 markets across Asia with 3 further markets scheduled for launch by the end of 2020. Our mission is to support over 200 million people in Asia every month by providing them easy and fast access to trustworthy, relevant and engaging health content and services in our journey to become the World’s largest digital health network.
Your Mission
To support day to day business operation and to ensure the sustainability of working progress.
You will support the expansion and growth of the business through generation of fast execution through the guiding of your line managers.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR   ktchea@hellokrupet.com #8 Street75, Sangkat Sras Chork, Khan Donpenh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.
