Job Description:
Job Purpose: To sell insurance policies that suit customers’ financial needs, and to maintain existing customers.
Job Description:
- Establish new customer base through prospecting, leads (from bank partners and digital platform) and networking.
- Call potential customers for appointment setting.
- Interview prospective or referred customers to get information about their financial resources, protection need and discuss existing coverage.
- Explain customers the features of various products and offer the ones that suit customers’ need.
- Analyze customers’ current insurance policies and suggest additional. protection or financial solution.
- Handle policy renewals.
- Maintain client relationships.
- Develop weekly work plans that involve calling and scheduling appointments.
- Submit weekly activities and result reports.
- Service existing customers.
- Attend training courses and seminars as needed.
- Perform other duties assigned by manager.
Job Requirement:
Qualifications & Experiences:
- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Marketing, Management or similar field.
- At least 1-2 year sales experience in financial industry or FMCG (previous experience as life insurance industry is advantage)
- Basic computer literacy (MS Word/Excel, PowerPoint, Internet, E-mail)
- Fair English (can read and communicate in English)

Skills & Behavior:
- Prospecting skills
- Self-organized
- Self-motivated and competitive
- Optimistic and positive attitude
- Strong desire to be successful
- Entrepreneur spirit
- Willingness to learn
- Outgoing personality
- Strong communication and people skills
- Honesty and integrity
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.

Job Description:
•	Calculation of the policy liabilities and required capital for demonstration of statutory solvency in accordance with local regulations and actuarial principles. Prepare reports on the statutory solvency position. Perform analysis to ensure optimal capital management for the company.
•	Preparation of financial results on various basis, including IFRS and EEV with accuracy, on a timely basis, on sound principles after thorough analysis.
•	 Modeling and profit testing of new products. 
•	Performing regular experience analyses in relation to expenses, claims and persistency.
•	Maintenance of reinsurance systems, preparation of accounts, and the assessment, documentation and update of reinsurance treaties.
•	Work closely with peers in the Finance team for financial reporting and budgeting & forecasting.
•	Sitting for and passing actuarial exams of a recognized professional actuarial association.
Job Requirement:
Required:
•	Must be a graduate, in a discipline which includes significant mathematical content, from a reputable institution. 
•	Good conceptual, analytical and financial skills.


Desirable:
•	Proficiency with MS Office desirable.
•	Understanding of accounting principles desirable.
•	Strong communication skills, MS Office, influencing & presentation skills.
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.

Job Description:
- Responsible of Housekeeping operation report to Room division Manager
- Assist with the implementation and maintenance of training system to ensure that associates have the necessary framework and skill to perform their job efficiently.
- Make planning and assignment for big event or high occupancy situation.
- Assigns team members their duties, and inspects work for conformance to prescribed standards of cleanliness.
- Prepares and distributes the Room assignment sheet and floor keys to room boys.
- Maintain clear and efficient communication and coordination with the Front Office and other departments of the hotel.
- Schedules the cleaning of the room carpets, upholstery, and draperies as needed, along with deep cleaning projects and window cleaning as necessary.
- Schedules cleaning for lobby area, public restrooms, telephone areas, hallways, entrances, elevators.
- Schedules periodic major cleaning projects including carpet shampooing, cleaning of walls and baseboards, cleaning of windows, elevator doors and tracks.
- Schedules cleaning of all meeting rooms after a completed function.
- Schedules deep cleaning of all meeting rooms on periodic basis including carpet shampooing, cleaning of walls and baseboards, cleaning of windows, etc.
- Inventories cleaning supplies & linen stock to ensure adequate supplies.
- Investigates concerns regarding housekeeping service and equipment, and takes corrective action.
- Provides support to the Executive Housekeeper in all areas of Housekeeping operation, such as staff training, coaching, counseling and also enforces to the hotels standard operating procedures.
- Ensure all meeting room functions are properly set up according to the requests indicated on the meeting room/event function sheets.
- Ensures guest rooms are properly secured and the housekeeping staff utilizes that proper key control procedures.
- Advises manager, desk clerk, & admitting personnel of rooms ready for occupancy.
- Rewards employees who use their empowerment to meet or exceed guest expectations.
- Maintain high quality of housekeeping standards in:  1) the guest rooms 2) linens and uniforms 3) lost and found procedures 4) laundry and 5) public area.
- Review outside laundry facility servicing to ensure quality, undamaged linens and consistent delivery, keeping in mind the budgetary guidelines.
- Review the housekeeping points on the guest feedback forms, take actions on guest complaints and also share guest compliments with staff members.
- Prepare annual housekeeping budget.
- Submit requests for repair and periodic maintenance of cleaning equipment.
- Prepares store requisition, purchase other supplies and equipment, also monitor par stock on all housekeeping guest supplies and linens.
- Control all expenditures relating to Housekeeping, including labor, guest room supplies, and all cleaning supplies and equipment.
- Oversee any guest communications from housekeeping.
- Performs other duties as assigned by General Manager.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor degree.
- Ability to use computer with Microsoft office & Internet E-mail
- Good written, verbal and communication skills
- Good Team work

Job Description:
1.	Support the adoption of the Regional IT Governance Framework and Standards
-	Support initiatives of the Regional IT Governance division
-	Where applicable, develop in-country processes and toolkits to support the operational adoption of the Regional IT Governance framework.
-	Ensure that in-country IT policies are viable for in-country adoption 
-	Support LBU with IT alignment and implementations through close partnerships with the Head of IT and other functional workstreams.

2.	Ensure alignment with the Regional IT Governance Framework
-	Collaborate with the Regional Office and ensure alignment to Regional IT guidelines and procedures 
-	Monitors changes in global and Regional guidelines to support the tactical adoption of governance strategies. 
-	Ensure effective implementation of the policies and procedures in PCLA
-	Should be able to perform an independent audit to look for any potential gap and work with relevant stakeholder to close the gaps

3.	Maintain register to identify PIC(Person-in-charge) for relevant policies & system/applications
-	PIC needs to be defined for all policies subjected to assessment
-	System owners of all applications should be maintained properly
-	Proactively ensure clear communication with PIC to keep a check on adherence of policies

4.	Ensure closure of gaps from regional assessment/audit/other parties for all in-scope governance policies
-	Work closely with relevant stakeholders from IT and Risk & Compliance to prepare response and closure of gaps
-	Communicate the audit remediation activity to relevant parties and ensure that action is taken and implemented within the agreed timeframe
-	Act as a liaison between IT department and all other IT compliance parties such as regional IT compliance team, Group-wise Internal Auditors, external auditors, IT regulators etc.
-	Keep assessment, evidence and other compliance documents in an organized manner and securely store for further reference

5.	Ensure best practice risk mitigation and assessment functions are maintained to comply with company strategy
-	Maintain IT department risk register
-	Work with Head of IT to consistently monitor change & release management process and ensure that processes are regularly updated to keep it relevant to updated policies

6.	Ensure governance activities, policies and decisions are communicated with the IT Management and Business Leadership to keep them informed of IT governance decisions that will affect IT services and projects.
-	In close partnership with the Head of IT, ensure regular dialogue and communication with other IT workstreams to review in-country IT activities and alignment to Regional IT strategies.

7.	Build and share knowledge to implement and embed good practice
-	Ensure accessibility of information to all relevant stakeholders.
-	Work closely with Head of IT to design and plan for professional development initiatives like Security Training, Risk Management Training, etc.
Job Requirement:
Required:
-	University degree in computer science, information technology or related field.
-	Have at least 5 years of experience in IT project management, IT security management, or Module management.
-	Experience in IT Governance and audit frameworks, use of JIRA, Kanban and other tools
-	Experience with systems, network hardware and administration.
-	Broad experience in all aspects of IT and business areas.
-	Proficient in communication

Desirable:
-	Experience in insurance principles and terminology
-	Experience in insurance and financial operations and services
-	Experience in Prudential company operations
-	Proficiency with industry or professional standards e.g. COBiT, ITIL, SDLC
-	Professional Certification such as Cisco, Microsoft and other professionals would be credentials.
-	Experience in using AGILE methodologies and Digital Transformation.
-	Knowledge of business/industry regulatory & compliance requirements
-	Knowledge of risk management principles
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.
Contact Info: Contact Information PCLA Recruitment HR Manager 087333908 pclarecruitment@prudential.com.kh Phnom Penh Tower, 20F, #445 Monivong Blvd, Boeung Prolit, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 087333908

Job Description:
•	Data-driven marketer in charge of attracting site traffic, converting that traffic into new leads for the business, and nurturing those leads to close into customers.
•	Understand Cambodia’s demographics, segmentation and needs, to build overall strategy for Insurance and Value-Added Services on PULSE to attract customers from all segments to the Prudential’s App.
•	Understanding customer segments and create user experiences that effectively engages customers at each stage of buying journey and increases usage which generates daily activity.
•	Experiment with various content formats such as written, visual, video, audio etc through various mediums like KOI/KOLs, Key Speakers, bloggers etc to develop a well-balanced content strategy.
•	Create various type of content for communities.
•	Develop content calendar, delegate tasks and ensure deadlines are met
•	Execute distribution plan of created content
•	Receive customer feedback and generate ideas to increase customer engagement
•	Spearhead testing new content types and developing strategies
•	Discover areas of improvement/opportunities with team processes and implement solutions
•	Facilitate content marketing relationships with interdepartmental stakeholders
•	Based on any given keyword, conduct thorough research and competitive analysis on a topic. Understand how to produce high-quality and competitive content
Job Requirement:
•	Proven work experience as a Content marketing manager
•	Proficiency in MS Office and WordPress or other Content Management Software
•	Expertise in social media platforms
•	Project management skills and attention to detail
•	Excellent communication and writing skills in English and Khmer
•	Has experience in doing keyword research and using SEO tools
•	Exceptional upward and downward communication skills, and the ability to communicate with important stakeholders about complex content and SEO matters
•	A passion for and a strong understanding of the industry and our business mission.
•	Exceptional writing and editing skills, as well as the ability to adopt the style, tone, and voice of the brand
•	Demonstrated background in writing for SEO
•	Excellent organizational skills to work independently and manage projects with many moving parts.
•	Ability to manage tight deadlines from multiple people.
•	Basic graphic design knowledge preferred.
•	Experience using content management systems
•	Experience using SEO research tools, such as SEMrush and Ahrefs etc.

Company Profile: Urban Hub Cambodia is a multi-award-winner and one of Cambodia’s biggest fully licensed real estate developers. Urban Hub Cambodia has quickly become a leading mixed-use property developer and the first developer ever from Cambodia to win the most awards including two major regional awards, “Best Condo Development in Asia 2019” and “Best Co-working Space in Asia 2020” at Asia’s longest-running and most respected property awards organized by PropertyGuru. Urban Hub Cambodia is behind the four most award-winning Cambodian projects both locally and regionally, including Urban Loft, Factory Phnom Penh, Urban Village Phase 1, and Urban Village Phase 2. More projects are expected in the near future.

Company Profile:
Smart Axiata Co., Ltd., Cambodia’s leading mobile telecommunications operator, currently serves 8 million subscribers under the ‘Smart’ brand. Smart Axiata is part of Axiata Group Berhad, one of Asia’s largest telecommunications groups.

Smart is at the forefront of mobile technology advancement in Cambodia. Smart was the first network to introduce 4G LTE in 2014, 4G+ in 2016 and 4G+ with HD Voice (VoLTE) in early 2017. In mid-2017, Smart introduced cutting-edge 4.5G, manifesting its data leadership position in Cambodia. Smart also provides 2G, 2.5G, 3G and 3.75G mobile services as well as international roaming across more than 190 countries. Its extensive nationwide network coverage stretches to more than 98% of the Cambodian population.

The company is also rapidly transforming itself into a digital lifestyle brand, having introduced many innovative offerings and lifestyle entertainment value propositions. This includes various international partnerships, with brands as diverse as Universal Music, Apple, Facebook and iflix, as well as digital services including SmartLuy, Smart Insurance, SmartPay, Smart Music and SmartNas. Smart aspires to become Cambodia’s Digital Champion, while playing an active role in socio-economic growth.

The company’s workforce consists of more than 1000 local and foreign experts. Smart is committed to its customers, employees and the people of Cambodia, in delivering its promise of enriching their lives through world-class networks, exceptional digital experiences and through significant corporate social responsibility engagements.

Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.

Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.

Company Profile: AIA Cambodia is guided by our Purpose to help Cambodians live Healthier, Longer, Better lives. Since commencing business in 2017, we’ve become the first life insurer to provide coverage on 26 critical illnesses. As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.

Job Description:
- Establishing strategy and procedures for the audit Department to undertake audit reviews and investigations on both internal and external fraud.
- Work closely with the fraud management team to set strategy to prevent and protect both internal and external and external fraud.
- Leading and managing reviews on the effectiveness, efficiency, and governance of the MFI’s activities including. E.g. business conducted, personnel, risk management, systems, operational and financial controls, performing reporting. 
- Assessing and identifying improvements to control systems, procedures and governance.
- Designing/ Preparing and presenting internal audit progress reports for audit committee.
- Preparing audit plan and performing the operational and financial audit.
- Identifying business process risk.
- Developing testing methodologies to evaluate the adequacy and accuracy of internal control.
- Internal control and evaluation and testing.
- Document the result of audit testing and provide the audit recommendation with effective and efficient control set up. 
- Monitoring and reporting on the status of outstanding action.
- Formulating professional development and education plans for the junior staff member.
- Providing advice on internal control including interpretation of relevant policies and procedures, liaising with other internal functions and external assurance providers where required.
- Ad hoc duties / projects as assigned by Senior Management and Director.
Job Requirement:
- Strong audit experience and a proven record of success in the financial market division of the internal audit department of a major financial services business.
- Professional accounting qualification (ACA or equivalent).
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with clear and concise reporting abilities.
- Ability to supervise teams of professional staff and manage projects and priorities.
- Ability to work effectively both within a team environment and independently. 
- Possess good spoken and written English.
- Team players with “CAN DO” attitude.

Job Description: The graphic designer/video editor is charged with determining the best ways for us to visually represent our company’s creative products. It is very much a people-oriented job, involving development of high-level creative concepts for design projects including branding, animations and infographics for video, print , social media outlets and product video presentation. It also involves working with internal and external, vendor, pitching designs, and understanding the  branding and solutions marketing objectives.Key Responsibilities:- Developing brand strategy and providing creative concepts and designs to the different campaigns - Work closely with the team to visually explain complex data findings, including infographics.- Assist with the writing and presentation of cohesive and persuasive rationales for campaign creative approaches, including page layout, presentation design, icon creation and photo editing.- Assist with the artistic input and design for print materials, video contents and social media products..- Guide the cycles of campaign development from the initial brainstorming, creative approaches and analysis of available market researches, to the different phases of production development and implementation.- Facebook Posting, Maintain Website Posting and Graphic/Video Posting- Video Product Presentation
Job Requirement: - At least 2 years of visual design and video editing experience- Knowledge of layouts, graphic fundamentals, typography, video editing and web limitations; must have the ability to storyboard or translate ideas to team members- A demonstrated working knowledge of experience design, brand development, and creative process- Strong knowledge of Adobe collections, Any Video Editor, InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator, in addition to an understanding of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.- Ability to work on multiple projects and deadlines.- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.- Strong written and oral communication skills.

Job Description:
• Check Safety Plan of contractors in coordination with Senior Site Engineer and Project Manager.
• Attend Safety Induction carried out by contractors.
• Is part of the project safety council and leads all efforts to enhance safety
• The safety officer reviews and approves all subcontractor’s safety plans
• Conducts investigations of all accidents and near-misses.
• Verifies that injury logs and reports are completed and submitted to the Construction Manager.
• Verifies that all tools and equipment are adequate and safe for use.
• Promotes safe practices at the job site.
• Enforces safety guidelines.
• Ensure Weekly Safety Walk-through in coordination with contractors Safety Officer/Staff.
• Record Safety violations and formulate a penalty system.
• Responds to employees’ safety concerns.
• Inspects the site to ensure it is a hazard-free environment.
• Others that may be instructed from time to time by the immediate supervisor/Senior Engineer/Manager related to Safety, documents, and emergency issues.
Job Requirement:
• At least one year of experience in a related role.
• Experience in the property development field is a plus.
• Bachelor’s degree in Administration and Management
• Good skill in Microsoft Word, Excel & PowerPoints, Internet, or Email.
• Good English
• Organizational skills
• Attention to detail
• Exceptional multitasker
• Excellent communication skills
• Honesty, committed and hardworking

Job Description:

job title: Sales Manager (1Post), Sales Supervisor (2posts), Sales Channel (4posts)
position: Sales Manager (1Post), Sales Supervisor (2posts), Sales Channel (4posts)
Job Description: We are looking for hardworking, strong commitment, smart and over achieving as Sales Manager, Sales Channel and Sales Engineer  with proven experience and a passion for technical and selling technology solutions.1. Sales Manager (1Post) 2. Sales Supervisor (2posts)3. Sales Channel (4Post)1. Sales Manager:Duties & Responsibilities:- Determine annual unit and gross-profit plans by implementing marketing strategies; analyzing trends and results- Establish sales objectives by forecasting and developing annual sales quotas for regions and territories; projecting expected sales volume and profit for existing and new products- Implement national sales programs by developing field sales action plans- Maintain sales volume, product mix and selling price by keeping current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators and competitors- Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies- Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed- Plan to ensure achievement of divisional and personal target, aligning with company sales policies and strategies- Manage, develop, coach, control and motivate the sales force to develop their skill to ensure that a high professional standard is achieved and monthly sales target and KPI target are met- Ensure targets are delivered through people management, performance review, reward and individual recognition- Assess the strengths and weaknesses of the sales team and manage to set the sales program accordingly- Provide on-the-ground support for sales associates as they generate leads and close new deals- Meet with customers to discuss their evolving needs and to assess the quality of our company's relationship with them- Develop and implement new sales initiatives, strategies and programs to capture key demographicsProvide daily report of field sales success and communicate VOC data to superiors- Sell to existing and potential direct accounts as well as provide sales support to distribution partners to participate in closing and order or to facilitate and add value to the selling process- Continually develop knowledge of the business climate, applications and competition for his/her defined geography and accounts- Develop, maintain and execute a territory plan- Continually assess current business distribution channels, develop and evaluate their performance and manage conflict ensuring alignment with territory plans- Maintain data relative to partners, accounts and activities and will document customer interactions- Reporting to management 2. Sales Supervisor's Duties and Responsibilities- Understand customer needs and offer solutions and support- Recruit, hire, and train new sales representatives- Actively seek out new sales opportunities through cold calling, networking and those social media- Research potential leads from the business directories, web searches, or digital resource to organize with sales representation- Organize and coordinate sales representatives schedules- Conduct market research to identify selling possibilities and evaluate customer needs- Set up meetings with potential clients and listen to their wishes and concerns- Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations on products and services- Create frequent reviews and reports with sales and financial data- Ensure the availability of stock for sales and demonstrations- Participate on behalf of the company in exhibitions or conferences- Receive and report on all sales leads- Answer potential customer questions and follow-up call questions- Spot check, Track weekly, monthly, and quarterly performance and sales metrics- Negotiate/close deals and handle complaints or objections- Gather feedback from customers or prospects and share with internal teams- Meet all sales quotas and collaborate with team members to achieve better results and exceed goals3. Sales Channel Duties & Responsibilities:- Selling company products through resellers/channels in assigned territory. - Represents the company in all activities associated with reseller/channel support- Conduct market research to identify selling possibilities and evaluate customer needs - Submit regular sales reports and updates to supervisor or manager- Actively seek out new sales opportunities through cold calling, networking and social media- Set up meetings with potential clients and listen to their wishes and concerns- Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations on products and services- Maintain accurate/updated customer profiles, pipeline, sales lead & sales activities (eg. sales visit plans, sales visit report, and quotation)- Monitor and report on market and competitor activities and provide relevant reports and information
Job Requirement: Associate Degree or BS degree in Marketing, Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalent.• 2-4 years of experience as Sales Executive, Sales Marking, Sales Engineer or equivalent• Can communicate in English• Motivated to learn new skills and technologies.

governmental organization currently operational in 136 countries worldwide including 14 countries in Asia Region.

programs to strengthen families and communities as a preventive measure in the fight against abandonment and
social neglect of children without parental care or children at the risk of losing parental care. We build families for
children in need; we help them shape their own future; and we share in the development of their communities
regardless of their ethnic roots, nationality and religion for an independent life. SOS Children’s Villages has strong

job title: Assistant Finance Manager ( Audit Background is preferable) 1K to 1.5K
position: Assistant Finance Manager ( Audit Background is preferable) 1K to 1.5K
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities:

Frameworks Setup:

•	Assist the FM in developing centralized frameworks for Financial Accounting (FA) and Managerial Accounting (MA) 
•	Work with businesses in subsidiaries and partners to integrate, and tailor the frameworks into practical Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) that fit with the business needs
•	Coaching and mentoring Accounting and Finance team to implement the policies and procedures in the businesses
Internal Financial Audit:
•	Assist the FM in developing frameworks and SOPs for performing internal audit on implementation of financial SOPs and the accuracy of data prepared by the operating businesses
•	Lead and supervise the internal audit projects and report the findings to the top management
Networking:
•	Assist the FM in developing frameworks and SOPs to establish networking related to financing
•	Establish and maintain good relations with sources of fund including but not limited to shareholders, banks, and funds (Venture capital, Hedge funds, investment banks…etc.)
•	Upon business needs, the AFM will provide the networking and support necessary for the businesses to obtain the optimal source of fund
Taxation:
•	Assist the FM in developing frameworks and SOPs on taxation advisory services provided by Modernity Holding to the subsidiaries and partners
•	Provide tax declaration advisory and consultation for the subsidiaries and partners upon requested
•	Maintain knowledge database of important tax laws and relevant tax information
•	Regularly send relevant tax information to the relevant subsidiaries and businesses
•	Provide support for tax resolutions during tax audits and tax issues
Job Requirement:
Job Requirements:
-	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related disciplines 
-     At least 3 years working experience in similar role or work as Auditor
-     ACCA qualification is preferable
-	Analytical and detail oriented 
-    Good at written and verbal communication skills in English and Khmer
-     Well knowledge in Cambodian Taxation Law and Regulations
-	Well knowledge in finance, accounting, budgeting, cost accounting and cost control principles

How to Apply:
Working time: Monday to Friday (8:00 AM-5:30 PM)
Contact person: HR Department
Add: #47, St. 294, Sangkat Beoung Kengkang I, Khan Chamkamorn, Phnom Penh.
Email: hrmanager@modernityholding.com
Tel: 085 555 831 | 093 555 860

Job Description:
Frameworks Setup:

• Develop and implement centralized frameworks for Financial Accounting (FA) and Managerial Accounting (MA)
• Work with businesses in subsidiaries and partners to integrate, and tailor the frameworks into practical Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) that fit with the business needs
• Coaching and mentoring businesses to implement the policies and procedures in the businesses

Internal Financial Audit:

• Develop and implement frameworks and SOPs for performing internal audit on implementation of financial SOPs and the accuracy of data prepared by the operating businesses
• Lead and supervise the internal audit projects and report the findings to the top management
• Audit the budget implementation whether it has met the target, and request explanation on the reasons for discrepancies.
• Analyze the impact the discrepancies on the investment and report to top management or investors

Networking:

• Develop and implement frameworks for financial information for business plan that is suitable for the sources of fund which includes forecasting frameworks, financing (use of fund and repayment of fund frameworks)
• Establish and maintain good relations with sources of fund including but not limited to shareholders, banks, and funds (Venture capital, Hedge funds, investment banks…etc.)
• Coaching and mentoring businesses on how to implement the frameworks for forecasting and financing (use and repayment of fund)
• Upon business needs, the FM will provide the networking and support necessary for the businesses to obtain the optimal source of fund 
Taxation:

• Develop and implement frameworks and SOPs on taxation advisory services provided by Modernity Holding to the subsidiaries and partners
• Develop, implement, and monitor frameworks for the preparation of monthly and annual tax declaration
• Coach and mentor businesses on how to properly prepare tax declaration
• Provide continuous tax declaration advisory and consultation for the subsidiaries and partners upon requested
• Review monthly and annual tax declaration submitted by the businesses
• Maintain knowledge database of important tax laws and relevant tax information
• Regularly send relevant tax information to the relevant subsidiaries and businesses
• Provide support for tax resolutions during tax audits and tax issues

Financial and People:

• Directing financial planning and strategy
• Analyzing and reporting on financial performance
• Ensures that company financial records, under responsibility, are maintained in compliance with company policies and CIFRS for SMEs. Responsible for reviewing monthly/quarterly account reconciliations and other documents to ensure this compliance
• Reviewing departmental budgets
• Assessing, managing, and minimizing risk
• Ensures that the computer system continues to operate as required. Involved in validating/designing suggested changes to ensure accounting requirements continue to be met
• Provides technical accounting guidance and support to all company entities
•Ensures that the finance department is staffed with qualified financial personnel capable of meeting the objectives and responsibilities, noted above. Responsible for continued development of these associates
• Develop Leadership and Employee Accountability: succession, communication, attrition, development
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related disciplines
• At least 3 years working experience in similar role
• ACCA qualification is preferable
• Analytical and detail-oriented
• Good at written and verbal communication skills in English and Khmer
• Well knowledge in Cambodian Taxation Law and Regulations
• Well knowledge in finance, accounting, budgeting, cost accounting and cost control principles

Job Description:
• Prepares work to be accomplished by gathering information and materials.
• Plans concept by studying information and materials.
• Illustrates concept by designing rough layout of art and copy regarding arrangement, size, type size and style, and related aesthetic concepts.
• Obtains approval of concept by submitting rough layout for approval.
• Prepares finished copy and art by operating typesetting, printing, and similar equipment; and purchasing from vendors.
• Prepares final layout by marking and pasting up finished copy and art.
• Ensures operation of equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements; following manufacturer’s instructions; troubleshooting malfunctions; calling for repairs; maintaining equipment inventories; and evaluating new equipment.
• Completes projects by coordinating with outside agencies, art services, printers, etc.
• Maintains technical knowledge by attending design workshops; reviewing professional publications; and participating in professional societies.
• Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor degree of Graphic Design or related fields
• Experience required in design or related field of minimum 3 years
• Good communication skills both oral and written
• Strong in graphic design, creative, and flexibility
• Ability to work in team as well as independently
• Work under pressure.

Job Description:
- Lead in maintaining the server and computer infrastructure across locations of an organization to ensure that its users can easily access mission-critical applications.
- Configuring and managing servers of difference operating systems, such as Windows Server OS, Linux (CentOS), including installing, fixing issues, and upgrading while implementing enhancements to them to improve performance and reliability. Also design, implement and manage enterprise system H.O.
- Must be familiar, such as Active Directory, DFS, File, Exchange, Vmware ESXi, vCenter and HW management tools.
Supporting technology, such as back up tools Symantec, Configuration management, system inventory and monitoring tools
- Providing support for troubleshooting of IT systems by oversee and resolve problems of the server, network devices, and storage and client devices.
- Patching tools and security development plan and modifications document
- Act as a primary point of contact in working with WING business partner(s) and server, NOC, DB, security, helpdesk, developer team to analyse and resolve reported technical issues and/or performance issues with the various data center hardware and software platforms.
- Act as a point of contact in the creation (or notification) of incident report on system issue.
Participate in a rotating on-call schedule for off-hours support.
- Participate in travel for initiative on a support basis.
Provide day-to-day technical, administrative, and functional support for the various infrastructure systems.
Job Requirement:
- Graduated bachelor degree of Information Technology, preferably in the field of Computer Science.
- Completed or certified on Microsoft Windows Server Certification MTA, MCSA and MCITP or MCSE
- Completed of Installing and managing Vmware ESXi version 5.5 up
- Completed of Linux administration CentOS or Red Hat Ent
- Minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience with Microsoft Windows server, vmware, exchange server and Physical Server
- Experience in 24x7x365 service delivery supporting mission-critical business operations
- 3+ years of administrator areas such as Domain Environment (AD, DNS, DHCP, DNS, etc.) and MS Exchange Server
- 3+ years of administrator on CentOS
- 3+years of managing on Vmware EXSi and vCenter
- 3+ years of managing HW server management tools
- Troubleshooting for network, hardware, and software problem level 1
- Provide periodic and regular status on the health of company systems environment
- Good communication skills, both verbal and written English Excellence organization and time management skills
- Having high level of confidentiality, integrity and business ethic
- Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines
- Be detail oriented
- Be able to carry out multiple assignments
- Have effective coaching and mentoring guidelines.
Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

Company Profile:
Cambodian Derivatives Exchange ("CDX") is recognized by the Ministry of Economy and Finance of Cambodia and Securities and Exchange Commission of Cambodia. CDX is dedicated to facilitate derivative broker in effective and efficient order execution and clearing, provide fair, open and transparent trading system to investors and contribute progressively to the Cambodia derivatives market, leading the global financial market.

CDX is a true leader, leading the way forward in a fast growing emerging market, transforming the path towards a regulated standard for a diverse global experience.

CDX continues to progressively enrich the quality of education and services through solutions and technology surrounding the Cambodia financial markets. Job Description:
·  Handle full scope of QS duties which includes material take-off and variations.

·  Prepare summary reports
·  Value completed work and arrange progressive payments to contractors / subcontractors / vendors.

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services

Company Profile:
From a very humble beginning as a small roofing sheet roll former in 1997, ISI STEEL, A member of ISI GROUP, has successfully transformed itself from a family-run business into a midsize corporation leading Cambodia's steel processing industry. With modern processing facilities, world-class management systems and technology, dedicated staff and nationwide distribution networks serving our customers nationwide, ISI STEEL has become a truly reliable and respectable local brand synonymous with quality roofing and wall cladding systems and structural steel products.

This would not have been possible without the strong support of our customers, local and international business partners, our staff's dedication and hard work, and last but not least the government efforts for maintaining the political stability and sustainable economic growth. To ensure our company’s sustainable development and industry-leading position, we are committed to further invest in upgrading our manufacturing facilities, expanding our distribution network, building up our human capital, technology infrastructure, and product innovations to better meet our customer's need and expectation.

While continuing to strengthen our core capabilities in the manufacturing and distribution of quality coated steel products, we have over the years ventured into a number of related diversifications such as pre-engineering steel building fabrication, property development including industrial park, residential, offices and resorts developments, and other construction materials trading business through our subsidiary and affiliated companies to capture the opportunities in the growing economy of Cambodia.

Job Description:
-Song Saa Private Island is Cambodia’s first private island resort, setting new benchmarks for luxury and sustainability. This award-winning five-star property has 27 luxurious villas in an incredible island setting. 

The Maintenance Manager helps to lead our skilful Engineering team who pride themselves on their ability to deliver extraordinary levels of customer service and creative solutions to our guests. 

The Maintenance Manager role requires a dynamic, highly motivated individual who embraces Song Saa’s vision of luxury that treads lightly to create an unforgettable guest experience to maintaining the natural assets that make this location so unique.
Job Requirement:
•	Assist Chief Engineer in providing senior leadership to manage the functionality and safety of the hotel facility, including the physical building/s, mechanical equipment, electrical system/s, heating and cooling systems and life safety systems and assets, in accordance with local laws and regulations. 
•	Assigns work, supervises staff and verifies and documents the completion of all routine maintenance and repairs in the property maintenance management system. 
•	Directly manage operating budget/cost controls (checkbook accounting) and execute capital projects, as assigned. 
•	Directs outside contractors and inspects quality of work by staff. 
•	Responds and coordinates responses to guest calls and emergency situations. 
•	In-charge of the Engineering Department in the absence of the Chief Engineer. 
•	Assisting Chief Engineer in all aspects of maintenance/engineering works and related activities.
•	Effectively manage and maintain the operation of all engineering systems including power generation plant, water treatment systems.
•	Ensuring that all building and equipment is kept in excellent condition.

•	Conducting preventive maintenance of all systems, laundry, kitchen, and water reused system.
•	Preventive maintenance of Guest Villa “fix asset, inspection” program
•	Controlling engineering staff attendance and annual leave.
•	Follow up on routine inspection and audits; 
•	Assisting with the recruitment of engineering employees that will meet the needs of the Song Saa Engineering Department.
•	Work closely with all relevant departments to ensure smooth running of the operation
•	Implement the property / company discipline procedure (Handbook) for all employees and ensure that this procedure is followed accurately for employees at all levels
•	Suggest and implement systems that maintain the effectiveness of all systems and ensure the safety of all Song Saa family members and guests.

Qualification & Experience:
•	Minimum University degree in Engineering.
•	At l
Company Profile:
Created with sustainability in mind, Song Saa Private Island reflects the beauty of the Cambodian coastline. It’s a place that breathes in time with nature, built from local materials, by local hands, and infused with local art and soul. An evolved tropical getaway with a pristine private beach, spacious wooden villas, heavenly spa sanctuaries and a preserved coral reef, Song Saa Private Island lets you detach from the world and tune into simple luxuries.

Built with reclaimed timber and materials from the mainland, the resort’s design and architecture reiterates our commitment to sustainability. Each villa is a private sanctuary, a refined blend of thatched roofs, linen-draped canopy beds, up-cycled décor and repurposed furniture. Discarded oil drums find new life as lamps. Driftwood serves as a table or bench. Salvaged wood from old fishing boats and factory yards now forms decks and floors and beams.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078330733 talent@songsaa.com Koh Ouen, Khan Mittapheap, Preah Sihanouk 078330733

job title: Senior Sales Marketing (1post) and Sales Marketing Presentation (2posts)
position: Senior Sales Marketing (1post) and Sales Marketing Presentation (2posts)
Job Description: We are looking for the following Marketing Team to lead our outbound marketing activities. You’ll be responsible for presenting our products in ways that will strengthen our brand and boost sales.For this role, you be a creative and quantitative thinker. You should be familiar with various product marketing techniques, like email campaigns and pricing strategies.Your goal will be to develop and implement the most profitable plans to position and promote our products.1. Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Job Description:
The IT Manager lead the IT department in order to create a modern technology platform as an instrument for effective operations in all departments and divisions of the Company and the Group, which open the abilities for business development and its competitive advantages on the market. The IT Manager should ensure a perpetual "business trend watch" to always keep Company at the latest or most advanced stage of development, innovation and pioneering in cutting-edge business evolution's. At any moment, the IT Manager could be asked to participate in projects for other Company.

1. RESPONSIBILITIES:

The IT Manager is reporting to the Group IT Director and his responsibilities are the following:
General: 
- Perform a general management of IT department.
- Manage the processes of choice, design, planning and implementation of technology solutions.
- Receive from entity management and group headquarters the business plans, growth strategies and other data necessary for production planning.
- Supervise the records management for acquired equipment components and software licenses; and their actual usage.
- Conduct the annual inventory of IT equipment and software and global IT audit.

Human Resources:
- Participate in design of IT department structure and its further adjustments.
- Communicate with recruitment agencies, universities and company’s HR department to search for candidates to IT department positions. 
- Hands on in recruitment platform such as LinkedIn and organize recruiting events.
- Review and interview candidates to IT department positions and propose the final choice for the approval of company management.
- Participate in staff conflict cases study and investigation of any types of violations made by IT staff members.
- Make recommendations to company management regarding encouragements or penalties for IT staff members.

Vendor and supply management:
- Management of the choice and interaction processes with telecom providers, equipment and software vendors, suppliers, and companies who perform maintenance, diagnostics and repair of equipment.
- Validate the negotiated new contracts with telecom providers, equipment and software vendors, suppliers, etc.

Project portfolio:
- Make sure there is existing business drivers and strategy including long range planning, strategic roadmap creation, transparent financial and portfolio reporting.
- Provides subject-matter-expertise and management across many technical disciplines, capabilities, services, technologies, domains or systems.
- Proactively identifies, implements and manages process improvements and agile/waterfall solutions within functional area.
- Leads cross-functional discussions/initiatives to anticipate and mitigate issues and achieve required outcomes within required time frames.
- Influences, interacts and makes decisions impacting across assigned disciplines, capabilities, services, technologies, domains or systems.

Quality Assurance:
- Implement in the company the corporate standards in technology and information security.
- Participate in development of company business processes automation, processes of interaction between divisions and other processes and procedures.
- Control the execution of implemented processes and procedures.

Budgeting:
- Administer funds from approved annual IT budget and budget of Group projects within the limits of granted rights.
- Perform the planning and control over company’s IT expenses and investments to technology.
- Draft and submit for approval the detailed annual IT budget and correspondent IT growth plans and project plans based on the information regarding business plans and growth strategy received from the entity management and Group headquarter.

Reporting:
- Prepare and submit to group headquarter regular reports about actual and forecasted IT expenses and projects.
- Per requests from Group headquarter, perform the analysis regarding IT department, used technology solutions, used service providers, and other areas connected to IT.

Grant Thornton Cambodia is an independent member within Grant Thornton International and a wholly foreign-owned company. Grant Thornton’s presence in Cambodia first started in 2004. Job Description:
The IT Manager lead the IT department in order to create a modern technology platform as an instrument for effective operations in all departments and divisions of the Company and the Group, which open the abilities for business development and its competitive advantages on the market. The IT Manager should ensure a perpetual "business trend watch" to always keep Company at the latest or most advanced stage of development, innovation and pioneering in cutting-edge business evolution's. At any moment, the IT Manager could be asked to participate in projects for other Company.

1. RESPONSIBILITIES:

The IT Manager is reporting to the Group IT Director and his responsibilities are the following:
General: 
- Perform a general management of IT department.
- Manage the processes of choice, design, planning and implementation of technology solutions.
- Receive from entity management and group headquarters the business plans, growth strategies and other data necessary for production planning.
- Supervise the records management for acquired equipment components and software licenses; and their actual usage.
- Conduct the annual inventory of IT equipment and software and global IT audit.

Human Resources:
- Participate in design of IT department structure and its further adjustments.
- Communicate with recruitment agencies, universities and company’s HR department to search for candidates to IT department positions. 
- Hands on in recruitment platform such as LinkedIn and organize recruiting events.
- Review and interview candidates to IT department positions and propose the final choice for the approval of company management.
- Participate in staff conflict cases study and investigation of any types of violations made by IT staff members.
- Make recommendations to company management regarding encouragements or penalties for IT staff members.

Vendor and supply management:
- Management of the choice and interaction processes with telecom providers, equipment and software vendors, suppliers, and companies who perform maintenance, diagnostics and repair of equipment.
- Validate the negotiated new contracts with telecom providers, equipment and software vendors, suppliers, etc.

Project portfolio:
- Make sure there is existing business drivers and strategy including long range planning, strategic roadmap creation, transparent financial and portfolio reporting.
- Provides subject-matter-expertise and management across many technical disciplines, capabilities, services, technologies, domains or systems.
- Proactively identifies, implements and manages process improvements and agile/waterfall solutions within functional area.
- Leads cross-functional discussions/initiatives to anticipate and mitigate issues and achieve required outcomes within required time frames.
- Influences, interacts and makes decisions impacting across assigned disciplines, capabilities, services, technologies, domains or systems.

Quality Assurance:
- Implement in the company the corporate standards in technology and information security.
- Participate in development of company business processes automation, processes of interaction between divisions and other processes and procedures.
- Control the execution of implemented processes and procedures.

Budgeting:
- Administer funds from approved annual IT budget and budget of Group projects within the limits of granted rights.
- Perform the planning and control over company’s IT expenses and investments to technology.
- Draft and submit for approval the detailed annual IT budget and correspondent IT growth plans and project plans based on the information regarding business plans and growth strategy received from the entity management and Group headquarter.

Reporting:
- Prepare and submit to group headquarter regular reports about actual and forecasted IT expenses and projects.
- Per requests from Group headquarter, perform the analysis regarding IT department, used technology solutions, used service providers, and other areas connected to IT.

Job Description:
Accountability:
Specific Activities:
Management Affairs
- Review operations and confer with technical or 
  administrative staff to resolve production or 
  processing problems.

  staffing requirements, work procedures, and duty 
  assignments, considering budgetary limitations and 
  time constraints.

Develop the laboratory

Others

Skills

 (Include things like honesty/integrity, work

  .ect.)

Job Description:

- Assist to examine all kind of patients and treat them for diseases in acute or chronic, critical or stable conditions.

- Assist in operating all surgeries to patients.

- At least 2 years work experience serving as medical doctor.
- Must understand, speak, and write English at an intermediate level
- Willing to learn and work under supervision of specialist doctors

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.

Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Company Profile: Urban Hub Cambodia is a multi-award-winner and one of Cambodia’s biggest fully licensed real estate developers. Job Description:
** Job Purpose: 
The job holder is responsible for leading the Administration and Property Management Department to ensure effective management of property and overall administration across the bank.

** Job Dimension:
- Budget (Operating/Capital): As per the Delegation of Authority
- Total No. of Reporting Staff:      2  

** Communications & Working Relationship
- External: Local authority, suppliers, contractors
- Internal: All staff

** Key Responsibilities:
* Property
- Responsible for maintaining all bank’s premises and Lease properties per lease agreement.
- Provide assistance in reviewing work carried out by contractors so it is completed on time.
- Review invoices presented are in line with quote and paid in time.
- Review maintenance checklist, if any, issued by Consultants to carry out maintenance program.
- Ensure bank vehicles are properly utilized and in good & safe driving condition.
- Responsible for the change/updating of Branch Prime Lending Rate.
- Handle tenancy for the premises of the branch(es).

* Administration
- Managing supplies and procurement, contractual order placement functions, Vendor management, establishing contracts and SLAs where possible.
- Handle ad-hoc projects such as renovation of premises, event management, etc.
- Managing logistics, inventory and stock taking functions.
- Overall management of project costs. Plan, develop and implement cost effective workflow strategies and solutions in line with budget allocations.
- Liaise with Department Heads regarding the storage of documents as per Records Management instructions.
- Manage destruction of bank vouchers, records, files, document every three months. These documents must be more than 10 years old from date of last transaction.

* Leadership:
- Take ownership of staff’s performance and development.
- Manage ongoing staff performance by providing coaching and guidance
- Provide feedback on performance
- Encourage and maintain open and candid communication links
- Keep staff informed of CIMB Bank objectives and their role in those plans
- Career guidance and advice
- Assess training needs and recommend programs for technical skills, interpersonal skills, relationship building
- Create an inspiring and collaborative work environment that enables others to excel
Contact Info: Contact Information Thann Nekhatanou  023 988 388 / 081 240 333 careers.kh@cimb.com 20AB, Corner Preah Norodom Boulevard & Street 118, Sangkat Phsar Chas, Khan Daun Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 023 988 388 / 081 240 333

•ថែទាំ និង ជួសជុលរថយន្តជារៀងរាល់ថ្ងៃ ដើម្បីឲ្យប្រាកដថា ខ្លួនពិតជាបានត្រួតពិនិត្យមើលប្រេង ទឹក អាគុយ 
ហ្រ្វាំង កង់ ជាដើម។
•ធានាថារថយន្តត្រូវបានសម្អាត និងថែទាំបចេ្ចកទេសបានត្រឹមត្រូវ។
•សហការជាបុគ្គលិកនៅផ្នែកផ្សេងៗទៀត ដើម្បីឲ្យធ្វើឲ្យមានទំនាក់ទំនងល្អក្នុងការងារ។
•ជួយការងាររបស់អ្នកបើកបរដទៃទៀត ក្នុងករណីចំបាច់ និង បំពេញការងារផ្សេងៗ។
•ការងារផ្សេងទៀតក្រោមការចាត់ចែងរបស់អ្នកគ្រប់គ្រង។
Job Requirement:
•កម្រិតសិក្សាចាប់ពីថ្នាក់ទី១២ឡើងទៅ។
•មានបទពិសោធន៍បើកបរយ៉ាងតិច ២ឆ្នាំ។
•យល់ដឹងពីច្បាប់ចរាចរណ៍និងបទបញ្ជាផ្សេងៗនៃ ចរាចរណ៍ផ្លូវគោក និងចេះដោះស្រាយបញ្ហាព្រមទាំងជួលជុល។រថយន្តពេលដែលខូចរឺក៏មានបញ្ហានៅតាមផ្លូវ។
•អាចទៅធ្វើការនៅតាមខេត្តតាមការចាត់តាំងរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន។
•មានបណ្ណបើកបរត្រឹមត្រូវ និងមានសុពលភាព។
•មានជំនាញក្នុងការទំនាក់ទំនងល្អ មានភាពអត់ធ្មត់ ស្មារតីទទួលខុសត្រូវខ្ពស់ ស្មោះត្រង់ និងឧស្សាហ៍ព្យាយាម។

job title: Senior Officer, Operation Support Agent Banking
position: Senior Officer, Operation Support Agent Banking
Job Description: •	Support agent banking operations following process and procedures to ensure project support and implementation are timely delivered•	Escalate and facilitate Cross-functional business units to deliver outstanding supporting tasks•	End to end coordinate activities with the procurement team, marketing team, tech team, and other stakeholders as a representative of the Business Unit.•	Be independent in delivering daily routine jobs such as solving the issue of a Project/ Marketing campaign that is operating, generating commercial report in a timely manner, and provide necessary and immediate reporting to operations, finance, and settlement team, etc.•	Monitor and track the Operations project’s progress, report on the progress of a project to all stakeholders.•	Prepare/update project status reports, process PR and PO, update tracking reports and maintain files for due diligence and financials•	Create and maintain comprehensive documentation, plans, and reports, campaign proposals, claims and reimbursement form sales team and budget with marketing and finance team
Job Requirement: •	Bachelor’s Degree in business administration, Marketing, or Management•	At least 2 years’ management experience in banking/fintech•	Understand about data analytics and commercial intelligence report would be a plus•	Understand an overview of competitive market in digital payment•	Understand the role of retail/agent/merchant/bill payment in fintech industry•	Ability to effectively manage and handle multiple deadlines and complex issues•	Positive and self-confident attitude•	Possess sense of urgencies•	Excellent in English languages•	Good presentation skill•	Planning and budgeting•	Good communication skills•	Outgoing personality•	Strong and high level of relationship building•	Occasionally mobile to other provinces
Company Profile: Since its founding in 1982, Chip Mong has focused extensively on the changing needs of the society and the strengthening of its relationships with business communities, both domestically and internationally. In recent years, Chip Mong has experienced tremendous growth and evolved into one of the largest groups of companies in the country, comprising seven wholly-owned subsidies, three joint-ventures, and two hotel projects. Chip Mong’s businesses include construction and materials, consumers goods, property development, beverages, general industrials, hospitality, retail and feed. The Company also offers a vast array of consumer products from well-known manufacturers throughout the region.

job title: Assistant Head of HR Department (Manager Level, 01 Position)
position: Assistant Head of HR Department (Manager Level, 01 Position)
Job Description:
•Assist Head of HR to develop HR strategies. 
•Build employee relations with Head Office and branch office staff.
•Work closely with Personnel Unit to ensure 100% Labor compliance.
•Assist Head of HR to develop and revise HR policies both Khmer and English.
•Work closely with Training Unit to identify training need assessment (TNA) for staff and recommend training and development intervention to build staff capacity.
•Assist Head of HR to conduct formal and information survey on the compensation and benefits to ensure LOLC’s pay package are align with the market.
•Work closely with recruitment team to build LOLC employer branding and provide support when needed to ensure on time and quality recruitment. 
•Regularly monitor performance of all branches and departments and recommend ways of improvement.  
•Assist Head of HR to recommend promotion, suspension, dismissal, and/or transfer of staff at both Head Office and Branch Offices.
•Trains staff on HR Policies and Procedures.
•Investigates all disciplinary and grievance cases with the respective staff, provides guidance, and corrective action through counseling, training, or instituting disciplinary procedures.
•Assist Head of HR to ensure that every management’s decision to demote or terminate/dismiss a staff is in accordance with existing laws and regulations.
•Build networking with external stakeholders such as Ministry of Labor, agencies, and others.
Job Requirement:
•Minimum 3-year managerial experiences in human resources management. Experience with  Microfinance institution is an advantage.
•Master Degree/Bachelor Degree in human resources management or other related fields.
•Good knowledge of Cambodia Labor Laws and related Parkas.
•Strongly creative and innovative new things. 
•Strong leadership, motivational, and psychological skills
•Strong commitment and willing to travel to branch offices at least one week per month
•Good in English speaking and writing skill.
•Strong networking skills.
•Objectivity, sound judgment and problem-solving skills.


* Location: Head Office	
* Deadline: October 14, 2020
